hello I'm Hannah a technical customer
support associate here at the AWS office
in Dublin Ireland
today I'll show you the AWS free tier
and how to monitor your use of AWS free
tier services
let's get started
AWS freetail offers customers the
opportunity to try out AWS services for
free up to a specified limit there are
three different types of offerings under
the AWS free tier
trials the short time trial offers start
from the date you activate a service you
pay standard rates after the trial
period expires 12 months free this
provides limited usage for 12 months
after your initial sign up date you pay
standard rate after your 12 month free
usage term expires or if your
application use exits the free tier
limits always free this is available to
all AWS customers and doesn't expires at
the end of your 12 month AWS free tier
term
your 12-month AWS free tier expires at
the end of the month of your account
anniversary
the 12 months period cannot be extended
even though your access to Services
isn't restricted to AWS free tier it is
best practice to monitor your AWS free
tier usage so that you don't attract
unwanted charges you can use the AWS
budget tool to monitor your usage
the two notifies of the following
condition your actual spend is when it
reaches 85 percent your actual spend
reaches 100
if your forecasted spend is expected to
reach 100 percent
to create AWS budgets log into your AWS
account and go to your billing console
choose budget
choose create budget
import all information and Save
you can find more information about AWS
free tier by opening the article Linked
In the description for this video so now
you know what the AWS free tier is and
how to monitor your use of AWS free tier
Services thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
